item.title: [317] Dwarf Multicannon || Quality Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:26, topic:534043”]Java doc:

[quote]
Most programmers will have no use for this method. It is designed for use by sophisticated enum-based data structures, such as EnumSet and EnumMap.[/quote]

You shouldn’t rely on implicit ordering or the enum values, for example if one is to add another field in the enum, or even reorder it alphabetically, your code will break and it will be almost impossible to figure out why.

More elegant solution: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1574580/is-it-bad-practice-to-use-an-enums-ordinal-value-to-index-an-array-in-java[/quote]
going to read up on this a bit, thanks i appriciate it!

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Dwarf Multicannon || Quality Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Java doc:

Most programmers will have no use for this method. It is designed for use by sophisticated enum-based data structures, such as EnumSet and EnumMap.

You shouldn’t rely on implicit ordering or the enum values, for example if one is to add another field in the enum, or even reorder it alphabetically, your code will break and it will be almost impossible to figure out why.

More elegant solution: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1574580/is-it-bad-practice-to-use-an-enums-ordinal-value-to-index-an-array-in-java

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Dwarf Multicannon || Quality Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:20, topic:534043”][quote author=Strucker link=topic=652841.msg4374785#msg4374785 date=1381782988]
Can i ask why we have a cannon instance per player?

also i see what u dud hir i laek it

/** * The six cannon setup stages in chronological order (note: do not change * order, order is crucial!). */ private enum Setup { NO_CANNON, BASE, STAND, BARRELS, FURNACE, COMPLETE_CANNON }
order is crucial cuz ur using the ordinal method right?
[/quote]
So we can declare fields meant for the player in the DwarfCannon class. Also, if we accessed the DwarfCannon class statically or through the singleton-design we would have to have an instance of the player as a parameter in almost every method. I find it easier to just instance the class itself, but all and all it just comes down to preference

And yup[/quote]Oh i get you…
good job then

Read full topic

item.title: [317] Dwarf Multicannon || Quality Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“Strucker, post:19, topic:534043”]Can i ask why we have a cannon instance per player?

also i see what u dud hir i laek it

/** * The six cannon setup stages in chronological order (note: do not change * order, order is crucial!). */ private enum Setup { NO_CANNON, BASE, STAND, BARRELS, FURNACE, COMPLETE_CANNON }
order is crucial cuz ur using the ordinal method right?[/quote]
So we can declare fields meant for the player in the DwarfCannon class. Also, if we accessed the DwarfCannon class statically or through the singleton-design we would have to have an instance of the player as a parameter in almost every method. I find it easier to just instance the class itself, but all and all it just comes down to preference

And yup

Read full topic

95 errors

i would really appreciate if anyone offers to help me
also i’m using a pi based source.

edit: fixed some errors now got 63

I can give you the code I used (I manually fixed all errors) but it’s probably not the same as yours (I used cycle events):
DwarfCannon.java
MultiCannonObject.java
Position.java
And my Objects.java

I added a method to fill the cannon in DwarfCannon.java so be happy. You still have to implement everything.
[/quote]

Thank you i will use it and see if i got any errors left

@clawz fury

if you could do that its very very appreciated is it okay if i pm u the link of my source?[/quote]
sure go for it dude

item.title: [317] Dwarf Multicannon || Quality Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:9, topic:534043”][quote author=Clawz fury link=topic=652841.msg4374319#msg4374319 date=1381622899]
yeah, sorry about that its not really my best work
[/quote]
To be honest, you shouldn’t have the title say “Quality Tutorial” if it’s not your best work nor if it’s not so good.[/quote]
Well, it’s a quality tutorial in the sense where everything is explained to the best of my ability and for someone who doesn’t know java very well to still understand what’s going on.

The code itself isn’t my best work but the cannon works just fine. The only problem I’ve noticed is that sometimes if the cannon is facing diagonally it’ll shoot straight (If it’s facing north west, it’ll shoot at npcs that are north, etc.). But I’m going to attempt to fix that, and I’ll update the topic once I do. I didn’t really take the time out to make every little thing perfect, that’s the developers job

Read full topic
